intro: Fabera cretensis, commonly known as the Cretan Fabera, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Fabera cretensis is considered a vulnerable species.
